description.narrative: Children aged 0-5 years and their families most affected by the disaster have improved access to health, nutrition and WASH services that are life-saving, facilitate recovery and build resilience to promote a return to normalcy after an emergency., which contributes to Child Health, Child Health (Covid), Maternal And Newborn Health, Maternal And Newborn Health (Covid), Sanitation, Sanitation (Covid), Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition (Covid), Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children under 5 in targeted areas benefit from improved access to quality healthcare and nutrition, protection and development opportunities in their home, care and preschool environments.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children aged 0-5 years and their families most affected by the disaster have improved access to health, nutrition and WASH services that are life-saving, facilitate recovery and build resilience to promote a return to normalcy after an emergency.

description.narrative:
UNICEF assisted over 732,850 children, women, men and health care workers to prevent the spread of COVID-19 and ensure continuation of maternal and child health services in the new normal setting by providing essential guidance, equipment, and Infection, Prevention and Control (IPC) and WASH supplies.
| Status:On-track | As-of Date:25/08/2020

title.narrative: Number of Community Health Workers receiving support to maintain essential maternal, newborn and child health services since COVID-19 disruptions; disaggregated by type of support. [COVID]
